(a)	Without prior written approval of the Lenders, the Borrower shall not enter into a single transaction or a series of transactions (whether related or not) and whether voluntary or involuntary to sell, lease, transfer, acquire or otherwise dispose of any asset beyond a sum of Rs 10,00,000.

(b)	The Borrower shall not enter into any amalgamation, demerger, merger or corporate reconstruction.

19.6.	Security

(a)	The Borrower shall ensure that any Transaction Security expressed to be created by it or (as the case may be) expressed to have been created by it and to be evidenced in, any Security Document remains in full force and effect with the ranking and priority it is expressed to have.

(b)	The Borrower shall not do or omit to do anything or knowingly permit or cause anything
to be done or omitted to be done which would or could adversely affect any Transaction Security.

(a)	Borrower shall at all times during the currency of the Facility, at its own cost, keep its properties constituting the Transaction Security at least 110% insured against such risks and for such amounts and for such period and forms as is taken by other companies in similar business ("Insurance"), with the insurance policies endorsed in favor of the Security Trustee as a loss payee, with such insurance company or companies of repute.

(b)	The Borrower agrees that in addition to Insurance it shall arrange for insurance cover in respect of standing charges and loss or profit in business.

(c)	The Borrower shall, promptly upon receipt, provide certified copies to the Agent of all Insurances taken out pursuant to this Agreement.

(d)	The Borrower shall ensure that each of the Insurances required to be obtained pursuant to this Agreement is on terms and conditions which are reasonably satisfactory to the Agent.

(e)	The Borrower shall ensure that the Agent shall be given reasonable opportunity to review and approve, at the Borrower's cost and expense, the renewal of or changes to any Insurances (if applicable).

(f)	The Borrower shall, punctually pay all premiums, and all cost and expenses and other sums due in respect of the Insurances and, upon the request of the Agent from time to time, provide evidence of the payment of such premiums to the Agent.

(g)	The Borrower shall promptly notify the relevant Insurer of any claims under the Insurances and diligently pursue any claims under the Insurances, and promptly notify the Agent of the same.

(h)	The Borrower shall comply with all terms and warranties under the Insurances.

(i)	The Borrower shall not do or omit to do, or permit to be done or not done, anything which might prejudice rights of the Borrower or the Security Trustee as an insured, a loss payee or an additional insured to claim or recover under any of the Insurances.

(j)	The Borrower shall not vary, rescind, terminate, cancel or cause any of the Insurances to be varied, rescinded, terminated or cancelled.

(k)	The Borrower shall not create or attempt to create or permit to arise or exist any Security over the Insurances except as permitted under the Finance Documents.

19.9.	Credit Rating

The Borrower shall get this Facility rated by Credit Rating Agency at its own cost within a period of 180 (one hundred and eighty) days from the first Utilisation date, where it shall obtain a minimum credit rating of investment grade not less than "BBB" category and thereafter at annual intervals and submit a copy of such rating to the Agent.

19.9.	Credit Rating

The Borrower shall get this Facility rated by Credit Rating Agency at its own cost within a period of 180 (one hundred and eighty) days from the first Utilisation date, where it shall obtain a minimum credit rating of investment grade not less than "BBB" category and thereafter at annual intervals and submit a copy of such rating to the Agent.

19.10.	Nominee Directors

The Borrower shall within 90 (ninety) days from the date of this Agreement take all corporate and other actions to effectuate the right of the Lenders to appoint 2 (two) nominee directors on the Board (including, without limitation, amending the Borrower's Articles of Association) on the following terms and conditions:

(i)	the nominee director(s) shall be appointed in the Event of Default.

(ii)	the nominee director(s) shall be entitled to share with the Lenders from time to time any non-public information received by them in their capacity as a nominee directors in order to permit open communication with and among the nominee directors and the Lenders. The nominee director(s) shall also be entitled to provide to the Lenders, reports of any proceedings/meetings of the Board or committees thereof.

(iii)	the nominee director(s) shall neither be required to hold qualifying shares nor be liable to retire by rotation.

(iv)	the nominee director(s) shall be entitled to all the rights, privileges and indemnities of other directors of the Borrower, including the sitting fees and expenses as are payable by the Borrower to the other directors, but if any other fees, commission, moneys or remuneration in any form is payable by the Borrower to the nominee directors in their capacity as directors, such other fees, commission, moneys and remuneration in relation to such nominee director(s) shall accrue to the Lenders and the same shall accordingly be paid by the Borrower directly to the Lenders.

(v)	the nominee director(s) shall be appointed as member of all the committees of the Board, if so required by the Lenders.

(vi)	all expenditure incurred by the nominee director(s) or the Lenders in connection with such appointment or directorship or arising through performance of duties as nominee director(s) shall be borne by the Borrower.

(vii)	the nominee director(s) shall be entitled to receive all notices, agendas and other information provided to the directors and to .attend all meetings of the Borrower, meetings of the Board and meetings of any committees of the Board of which the nominee director(s) are members. If at any time any nominee director is not able to attend a meeting of the Board or any committee of which such nominee director is a member, the Agent may designate an observer to attend such meeting. All expenses incurred by the Agent in this regard shall be borne by the Borrower.

19.12.	Management

Unless otherwise approved by the Lenders in writing, the Borrower shall not make any changes to the composition of its management or policies governing the management of the business of the Borrower.

19.15.	Repayment to the Promoters

The Borrower shall not pay any debt to the Promoters •during the continuance of the Facility. Any debt provided by the Promoters to the Borrower shall be subservient to the Facility under this Agreement. Prior approval of the Lenders shall be obtained before making any payment to the Promoters.

19.16.	Dividend

The Borrower shall not declare or pay any dividend for the financial years 2009-10, 2010-11 and 2011-12 without prior written approval of the Agent/Lenders under the Facility.

20.1.	Non-payment

The Borrower does not pay on the due date any amount payable pursuant to a Finance Document.

20.2.	Financial covenants

Any requirement of Clause 18 (Financial covenants) is not satisfied or if there is a breach or variance of financial ratios as aforesaid by more than 10 per cent for two consecutive testing dates.

20.3.	Other obligations

The Borrower does not comply with any provision of the Finance Documents (other than those referred to in Clause 20.1(Non-payment) and Clause 20.2 (Financial covenants).

20.4.	Misrepresentation

Any representation or statement made or deemed to be made by the Borrower in the Finance Documents or in connection with any Finance Document is or proves to have been incorrect or misleading in any material respect when made or deemed to be made.

20.5.	Insolvency

(a)	The Borrower is or is presumed or deemed to be unable or admits inability to pay its debts as they fall due, suspends making payments on any of its debts or, by reason of actual or anticipated financial difficulties, commences negotiations with one or more of its creditors with a view to rescheduling any of its indebtedness.

(b)	A moratorium is declared in respect of any indebtedness of the Borrower.

20.7.	Creditors' process

Any expropriation, attachment, sequestration, distress or execution affects any asset or assets of the Borrower and is not discharged within 30 (thirty) days.

20.8.	Ownership of the Borrower

The Promoters cease to be the largest shareholder and in control of the management of the Borrower.

20.9.	Unlawfulness

It is or becomes unlawful for the Borrower (as per the opinion of the Agent/Lenders in their discretion) to perform any of its obligations under the Finance Documents or the Agent/Lenders have reasonable grounds to believe that the Borrower may not be in a position to fulfil its obligations under the Agreement or for any change in law or otherwise it becomes unlJwful for the Borrower to fulfil its obligations under any of the Finance Documents.

20.10.	Repudiation

The Borrower repudiates a Finance Document or evidences an intention to repudiate a Finance Document.

20.11.	Finance Documents

The Borrower fails to comply with any of the obligations assumed by it under the Finance Documents.

20.13.	Cessation of business
The Borrower suspends or ceases to carry on all or a material part of its business

20.14.	Material adverse change

Any event or circumstance occurs which might have a Material Adverse Effect.

20.15.	RBl's wilful defaulter's list

The Borrower or any of its directors are included in the RBl's willful defaulters list.

20.16.	Adverse Order

If any of the Security Provider/Borrower's indebtedness towards any creditor exceeding an aggregate amount of INR 1 Crore or its equivalent as determined by the Lenders is not paid when due pursuant to any Court/tribunal order/decree/judgment to which there lies no appeal.

20.18.	Material Approval

The Borrower fails to obtain any material approval, authorization or fails to make.any necessary filing which is necessary for its business;

20.19.	Voluntary Winding-up

The Borrower for the purpose of amalgamation or reconstruction goes for voluntary winding up, except with prior written approval of the Agent;

20.20.	Liabilities

It is certified by an Accountant of a Firm pf Chartered Accountants appointed by the Agent (which the Agent is entitled and hereby authorised to do so at any time) that the liabilities of the Borrower exceed the Borrower's assets or that the Borrower is carrying on business at a loss;

20.21.	Repayment

If any circumstance or event occurs which would or is likely to prejudicially or adversely affect in any manner the capacity of the Borrower to repay the Loan or any part thereof;

20.22.	License or Approvals

If any material approval or license of the Borrower is repudiated, terminated, becomes unenforceable or invalid including approvals for Acquisition;

20.24.	Expropriation

If any government authority shall have condemned, nationalised, seized, or otherwise expropriated all or any part of the assets of the Borrower or of the shares of the Borrower held by any director or promoter, or shall have assumed custody or control of such shares or the business or operations of the Borrower or shall have taken any action for the dissolution of the Borrower or any action that would prevent the Borrower or its officers from carrying on its business or operations or a substantial part thereof;

20.25.	Purpose of Loan

If the Loan or any part thereof is utilised for any purpose other than the purpose as mentioned in Clause 3.1;

20.26.	Ownership

Upon happening of, any material change in the constitution or conduct of business of the Borrower without previous written consent of the Agent.

20.27.	Cross Default

Upon happening of any default under any other facility obtained by the Borrower.

20.28.	Remedies to Event of Default

Upon the occurrence of any Event of Default, the Lenders directly or through the Agent shall become entitled to exercise the following rights:

(a)	Acceleration

On and at any time after the occurrence of an Event of Default which is continuing the Agent may, and shall if so directed by the Majority Lenders, by notice to the Borrower.:

(i)	cancel the Total Commitments whereupon they shall immediately be cancelled;

(ii)	declare that all or part of the Loan, together with accrued interest, and all other amounts accrued or outstanding under the Finance Documents be immediately due and payable, whereupon they shall become immediately due and payable; and/or

(iii)	declare that all or part of the Loan be payable on demand, whereupon they shall immediately become payable on demand by the Agent on the instructions of the Majority Lenders.

(iv)	exercise or direct the Security Trustee to exercise any or all of its rights, remedies, powers or discretions under the Finance Documents.

(b)	Further Conditions

Stipulate any further and additional terms and conditions as the Lenders deem fit with respect to the Finance Documents in which case the Borrower agrees to comply with such terms and conditions, including increase in the interest rate of the Loan;

(c)	Creditor's Rights

Sue for creditors' process and/or exercise all or any rights with respect to the securities given by the Borrower in accordance with the Finance Documents;

€ Conversion to Equity

Convert, at the option of the Lenders/ all or part of any outstandings and dues of the Borrower towards the Lenders under the Finance Documents into fully paid-up equity shares of the Borrower as per the Applicable Laws;

Nominee Directors

Appoint 2 (two) nominee directors on the Board;

Management

Review the management set-up or organization of the Borrower and suggest such changes to the same as may be considered necessary by the Lender, which the Borrower shall comply with;

Insurance Proceeds

Issue any notice regarding the payment of proceeds of any insurance or compensation received by the Borrower;

(i)	Concurrent_Auditor

Appoint concurrent auditor and determine the terms of the concurrent audit; and

(j)	Other Rights

Exercise such other rights as may be available to the Lender under the Applicable Laws and under the Finance Documents or any security documents or any other agreement entered in relation thereto;

Change in terms

Modify any of the terms and/or conditions of any Finance Document entered in relation thereto.

The Company undertakes to maintain in the Escrow Account the minimum stipulated cover of 1.4x out of Receivables (balance to be received from sold + unsold stock). The same to be maintained throughout the tenor of the Credit Facilities.

The Mortgagor shall also avail a comprehensive insurance policy for the Project during the course of implementation of the Project. The Mortgagor shall deliver certified copies of the insurance policies with the Security Trustee’s name duly endorsed thereon as loss payee and maintain such insurances throughout the continuance of the security of these presents and deliver to the Security Trustee the renewal receipts therefor and shall duly and punctually pay all premium and shall not do or suffer to be done or omit to do or be done any act which may invalidate or avoid such insurances. (xiii)	the Mortgagor shall not receive, compound or realise any of the Receivables nor do anything whereby the recovery of the same may be impeded, without the prior written consent of the Security Trustee and shall keep proper books of account of its business and shall at all times when required, produce such books to the Security Trustee for inspection of the Receivables and allow the Security Trustee (through its employees and agents) to have access thereto and to make copies of or extracts therefrom;

(xiv)	the Mortgagor shall be at liberty in the ordinary course of its business to receive all or any of the Receivables hereby charged assigned and transferred in favour of the Security Trustee. documents executed by the Lenders to novate or transfer or syndicate or call for participation in the 
whole or part of its Commitments and/or to assign the whole or part of its outstandings.

Increased costs 
(a) Subject to Clause 11.3 (Exceptions) the Borrower shall, within 15 (fifteen) Business Days of a 
demand by the Agent, pay for the account of a Finance Party the amount of any Increased 
Costs incurred by that Finance Party as a result of (i) the introduction of or any change in (or 
in the interpretation, administration or application of) any law or regulation or (ii) 
compliance with any law or regulation made after the date of this Agreement. The terms 
"law" and "regulation" in this paragraph (a) shall include, without limitation, any law or 
regulation concerning capital adequacy, prudential limits, liquidity, reserve assets or Tax. 
(b) In this Agreement "Increased Costs" means: 
(i) a reduction in the rate of return from the Facility or on a Finance Party's overall 
capital (including, without limitation, as a result of any reduction in the rate of 
return on capital brought about by more capital being required to be allocated by 
such Finance Party); 
(ii) an additional or increased cost; or 
(iii) a reduction of any amount due and payable under any Finance Document, 
which is incurred or suffered by a Finance Party to the extent that it is attributable to that 
Finance Party having entered into its Commitment or funding or performing its obligations 
under any Finance Document.

13.1. Transaction expenses 
The Borrower shall, within 7(seven) Business Days of demand, pay the Agent and the Security 
Trustee the amount of all costs and expenses (including legal fees) reasonably incurred by any of 
them in connection with the negotiation, preparation, printing and execution of: (i) this Agreement and any other documents referred to in this Agreement; and 
(ii) any other Finance Documents executed after the date of this Agreement. 
 
13.2. Amendment costs 
If the Borrower requests an amendment, waiver or consent, the Borrower shall, within 7 (seven) 
Business Days of demand, reimburse the Agent and the Security Trustee for the amount of all costs 
and expenses (including legal fees) reasonably incurred by the Agent or the Security Trustee (as the 
case may be) in responding to, evaluating, negotiating or complying with that request or 
requirement.

13.3 Enforcement costs 
The Borrower shall reimburse within 3 (three) Business Days and pay to the each Finance Party the amount of all costs, charges and expenses, including any fee charged by solicitors or advocates, company secretaries, stamp duty and legal costs on actual basis and other charges & expenses which may be incurred by the Lenders for the enforcement or attempted enforcement of the security to be created in terms of this Agreement.

13.5 Costs of Lenders’ Independent Engineer

1. Status 
(a) It is a company, duly incorporated and validly existing under the laws of India. 
(b) It and each of its subsidiaries has the power to own its assets and carry on its business as it 
is being conducted.

2. Binding obligations 
(a) The obligations expressed to be assumed by it in each Finance Document are, subject to any 
general principles of law limiting its obligations which are specifically referred to in any legal 
opinion delivered in accordance with Clause 4 (Conditions of Utilisation), legal, valid, binding 
and enforceable obligations. 
(b) Without limiting the generality of paragraph (a) above, each Security Document to which it 
is a party creates the security interests which that Security Document purports to create and 
those security interests are valid and effective. 

3. Non-conflict with other obligations 
The entry into and performance by it of, and the transactions contemplated by, the Finance 
Documents do not and will not conflict with: 
(a) any law or regulation applicable to it; 
(b) constitutional documents of the Borrower; or 
(c) any agreement or instrument binding upon it or any of its assets.

4. Power and authority 
(a) It does not suffer from any statutory or legal infirmities affecting the pursuit or running of its 
business/ undertaking. 
(b) It has the power to enter into, perform and deliver, and has taken all necessary action to 
authorise its entry into, performance and delivery of, the Finance Documents to which it is a 
party and the transactions contemplated by those Finance Documents. 
(c) No limit placed on it or the powers of its directors will be exceeded as a result of the 
borrowing, granting of Security or indemnities contemplated by the Finance Documents to which it is a party

5. Validity and admissibility in evidence 
 All Authorisations and statutory approvals required or desirable: 
(a) to enable it lawfully to enter into, exercise its rights and comply with its obligations under 
the Finance Documents to which it is a party; 
(b) to make the Finance Documents to which it is a party admissible in evidence; and 
(c) for it to carry on their business, and which are material, have been obtained or effected and are in full force and effect. 


6. Filings and Payments 
(a) All registrations, recordings, filings and notarisations of any Finance Documents and all 
payments of any tax or duty, including stamp duty, registration charges or similar amounts 
which are required to be effected or made and which are necessary to ensure the legality, 
validity, enforceability or admissibility in evidence of the Finance Documents, have been 
made and are in effect. 
(b) The Borrower has filed all tax returns and paid all Taxes and fees, including in relation to 
stamp duties and registration fees due and payable in relation to the Finance Documents.

7. No default 
(a) No Event of Default is continuing or might reasonably be expected to result from the making 
of any Utilisation. 
(b) No other event or circumstance is outstanding which constitutes a default under any 
Finance Document or other agreement or instrument which is binding on it or its assets are 
subject which might have a Material Adverse Effect.

8 No misleading information 
All information supplied by any Obligor is true, complete and accurate in all material respects as at 
the date it was given and is not misleading in any respect.

17. Authorised Signatures 
Any person specified as its authorised signatory under Schedule 3 (Part 1- Conditions precedent) or 
Clause 17.4 (Information: miscellaneous) is authorised to sign Utilisation Requests (in the case of the 
Borrower only) and other notices on its behalf.

9. Financial statements 
(a) Its Original Financial Statements were prepared in accordance with GAAP consistently 
applied save to the extent expressly disclosed in such Original Financial Statements. 
(b) Its Original Financial Statements give a true and fair view and represent its financial 
condition and operations during the relevant financial year save to the extent expressly 
disclosed in such Original Financial Statements. (c) There has been no material adverse change in the business or financial condition or the 
business or consolidated financial condition of the Borrower or any member of the Group 
since March 2013.

10. Priority ranking 
Its payment obligations under the Finance Documents rank in priority to claims of all of its other 
secured or unsecured facilities and secured or unsecured indebtedness, except for obligations 
mandatorily preferred by law.

11. No proceedings pending or threatened 
No litigation, arbitration or administrative proceedings of or before any court of law, arbitral body or 
agency which, if adversely determined, might reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse 
Effect have (to the best of its knowledge and belief) been started or threatened against it or any of 
its Obligors.

13. Good Title to Project Property 
It has good, valid and marketable title to, or valid leases or licences of, and all appropriate 
Authorisations to use the assets used in connection with Project Property (as may be applicable) 
over which security interest has been created pursuant to the Finance Documents and no term 
contained therein restricts it from or imposes any conditions (other than as set out in this 
Agreement) for (i) creating security interest over the Security, or (ii) the entry into, delivery and 
performance of its obligations under the Finance Documents.

14. Legal and Beneficial Owner 
The Borrower is the legal and beneficial owner of the Project Property which is subject matter of the 
Transaction Security.

15. Project 
(a) The Borrower is authorised and has in place all Authorisations to construct and complete 
the Project Property except to the extent disclosed to the Agent and approved by the Agent. 
(b) No term contained in any agreement executed by it or any Authorisation restricts or 
imposes any conditions upon it from either (i) creating security interest over the assets 
forming part of the Transaction Security (including but not limited to the Receivables), or (ii) 
the entry into, delivery and performance of its obligations under the Finance Documents.

16. Solvency 
(a) It is able to meet its obligations and pay its debts as they fall due, and has not admitted any 
inability to pay its debt as they fall due or has suspended making payments on any of its 
debts. 
(b) It has not by reason of actual or anticipated financial difficulties commenced, or intends to 
commence, negotiations with one or more of its creditors with a view to rescheduling any of 
its indebtedness. 
(c) The fair value of its assets is not less than its liabilities (taking into account contingent and 
prospective liabilities). 
(d) It has sufficient capital to carry on its business.
(e) No moratorium has been, or may, in the reasonably foreseeable future be, declared in 
respect of any of its indebtedness.

18. Insurance 
(a) All its assets to the extent it is insurable, over which a Security has been created or will be 
created in favour of the Security Trustee (for the benefit of the Lenders) have been insured 
and the insurance programme have been duly endorsed to the Agent and / or the Security 
Trustee as loss payees. 
(b) All insurance as per the insurance programme of the Borrower have been put in place at the 
times and in the manner required herein and are as contemplated herein and are in full 
force and effect and it has complied with all its obligations under the insurance programme 
including payment of insurance premiums and no event or circumstances has occurred nor 
has there been any omission to disclose a fact which in any such case would entitle any 
Insurer to avoid or otherwise reduce its liability there under to less than the amount 
provided in the relevant policy and insurance coverage provided by such insurance 
programme.

19. Wilful Defaulter List 
 The names of its Directors, promoters and Affiliates of the Borrower(as the case may be) are not 
included in the: 
(a) RBI’s wilful defaulters list or such Directors have been removed from its Board and it shall 
ensure that no such director shall be inducted or continue on its board at any time during 
the term of this Loan; 
(b) Any Lender’s wilful defaulters list.

20. Existing credit facilities 
The details of all the existing credit facilities submitted to the Lenders are true, complete and correct 
in all respects.

21. Correctness of the Representations & Warranties 
All its representations and warranties as set forth in this Agreement are true, complete and correct 
in all respects at the time as of which such representations and warranties were made or deemed to 
be made and shall continue to remain, correct and true till the Secured Obligations are discharged in 
full to the satisfaction of the Finance Parties.

22. Directors 
(a) No director, managing agent, manager or employee of the Borrower is a director of a 
banking company (as defined under the Banking Regulation Act, 1949), and no director of a 
Lender holds a substantial interest in the Borrower. 
(b) None of the directors of the Borrower is a director of a banking company (as defined under 
the Banking Regulation Act, 1949) and further none of the directors of the Borrower is a 
specified near relation (as specified by RBI) of a director of a banking company or a near 
relative of any senior officer (as specified by RBI) of the Lender.

23. Ownership 
The Promoters, together with the present shareholders as listed in Schedule 10 hold 100% of the 
entire paid up capital of the Borrower, whereby the Promoters together hold 85% of the entire paid 
up capital of the Borrower.

25. Other Creditors 
No legal proceedings or other procedure or step of such nature has been taken by any banks or 
financial institutions against the Borrower, its Affiliates, its business associates or in relation to the 
Projects.

That the Facility is not being availed for any activities relating to producing or consuming Control

India from time to time. Further that the Project is compliant with all Applicable Laws and has 
obtained all relevant environmental clearances for the proposed Project. That the Borrower has 
instituted and shall from time to time institute appropriate monitoring, evaluation and reporting 
processes and confirms and undertakes that its scope of work under the Project does not and/or 
shall not have any negative environment impact and appropriate corrective measures shall be taken 
as recommended by relevant authorities.

order to permit open communication with and among the nominee directors and the

the promoters, or shall have assumed custody or Control of such shares or the business or 
operations of the Borrower or shall have taken any action for the dissolution of the Borrower or any 
action that would prevent the Borrower or its officers from carrying on its business or operations or 
a substantial part thereof. 

20.28 Purpose of Loan 
If the Loan or any part thereof is utilised for any purpose other than the purpose as mentioned in 
Clause 3.1 (Purpose). 

20.29 Ownership 
 
Upon happening of any material change in the constitution or conduct of business of the Borrower 
without previous written consent of the Agent. 

20.30 Default and Termination 
Any Event of Default which occurs or is continuing under the contracts in relation to the Project 
which has or is likely to cause a Material Adverse Effect.

20.9 Unlawfulness 
It is or becomes unlawful for the Borrower (as per the opinion of the Agent/Lenders in their 
discretion) to perform any of its obligations under the Finance Documents or the Agent/Lenders 
have reasonable grounds to believe that the Borrower may not be in a position to fulfil its 
obligations under the Agreement or for any change in law or otherwise it becomes unlawful for the 
Borrower to fulfil its obligations under any of the Finance Documents.

20.17 Disputes 
If there are any conflicts, disputes or disagreements between the Borrower and the Project Parties 
which have not been resolved or settled to the satisfaction of the Lenders.

20.10 Repudiation 
The Borrower repudiates a Finance Document or evidences an intention to repudiate a Finance 
Document. 
20.11 Finance Documents 
(a) The Finance Documents or any provision hereof or thereof (A) is or becomes unenforceable 
or any party thereto shall have repudiated or taken any action to challenge the validity or 
enforceability of such document; or (B) is breached and such breach may have a Material 
Adverse Effect; or (C) except as otherwise expressly permitted hereunder, ceases to be in 
full force and effect except at the stated termination date thereof, or shall be assigned or 
otherwise transferred or prematurely terminated by any party thereto prior to the 
repayment in full of all outstandings under the Finance Documents (other than with the 
approval of the Finance Parties). 
Any Approval in relation to the Project or the Finance Documents is revoked/not 
obtained/not renewed.

20.16 Adverse Order 
If any of the Obligor/Borrower’s indebtedness towards any creditor exceeding an aggregate amount 
of Rs 1,00,00,000 (Rupees One crore) or its equivalent is not paid when due pursuant to any 
Court/tribunal order/decree/judgment to which there lies no appeal.

20.23 Repayment 
If any circumstance or event occurs which would or is likely to prejudicially or adversely affect in any 
manner the capacity of the Borrower to repay the Loan or any part thereof.

20.26 Rating Downgrade 
If the Borrower’s credit rating is downgraded below the minimum investment grade by a Credit 
Rating Agency
Tag 5: Covenant Description/ Sub tags: Repudiation, Breach of Covenants, Breach Financing Documents, Downgrade in credit rating

Clause from Loan Agreement:
20.12 Transaction Security 
(a) At any time any of the Security is or becomes unlawful or is not, or ceases to be legal, valid, 
binding or enforceable or otherwise ceases to be effective. 
(b) At any time, any of the Security fails to have priority or is subject to any prior ranking or pari 
passu ranking Security other than what is permitted under the Finance Documents. 
(c) At any time, any attachment, distress, execution or other process against any of the Security 
is enforced or levied upon. 
(d) At any time, any circumstance or event occurs which is prejudicial to or impairs or imperils 
or jeopardize or is likely to prejudice, impair, imperil, depreciate or jeopardize any Security 
or any part thereof or any event occurs which causes this Agreement or security documents 
or any related agreement to become ineffective. 
(e) At any time, without prior written consent of the Agent, attempt or purport to create any 
charge, mortgage, pledge, hypothecation, lien or other encumbrance over the Borrower’s 
property or any part thereof, which is or shall be the Security for the repayment of the dues payable under this Agreement, the Security Documents or any other agreement executed in this regard except for securing any other obligations of the Borrower to the Agent.

20.18 Project Contract 
Any breach of the terms of the Project Contract, as determined by the Lenders’ Independent 
Engineer or the Lenders.
 
20.19 Deterioration of Assets 
Except as may be permitted in this Agreement, if there is any deterioration or impairment of the 
assets forming part of the Security or any part thereof or any decline or depreciation in the value or
market price thereof (whether actual or reasonably anticipated), which causes the Security in the 
judgment of the Lenders to become unsatisfactory as to character or value.

20.31 Cross Default 
Upon happening of any default under any other facility availed by the Borrower or any Obligor or 
any Affiliate.

Conditions Precedent to Effectiveness
	
The obligation of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders to make available their respective Commitments pursuant to this Agreement shall become effective upon the Borrower fulfilling to the satisfaction of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders (unless any waiver is granted by the Rupee Term Loan Lenders in terms of Clause 11.4 (No Waiver)) all of the following conditions:

(i)	Tie Up of Debt

The Borrower shall have tied up the entire Debt component of the Project and shall have submitted satisfactory evidence, confirming the above in a manner satisfactory to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders.

(ii)	Execution of the Shareholders’ Agreement

The Borrower shall ensure that the Sponsors and/or the other shareholders of the Borrower execute an amended and restated shareholders’ agreement in accordance with the provisions of the Sponsor Support Undertaking(s) and the other Finance Documents to the extent applicable in a form and manner satisfactory to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders/Lenders Legal Counsel.

(iii)	Base Equity Commitment/ Sponsor Undertaking
	
The Sponsors shall have furnished an undertaking to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, stating that:

(a)	The Sponsors shall retain Management Control over the Borrower till the Final Settlement Date.
(b)	The Sponsors shall have subscribed to the Borrower’s Equity Shares or shall have contributed Subordinated Debt to the Borrower for an aggregate amount equivalent to INR 2,150 Million (Rupees Two Billion One Hundred and Fifty Million Only) out of the Base Equity Commitment, on the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement and the Sponsor Support Undertaking, and shall maintain such Base Equity Commitment (or any part thereof) or Subordinated Debt in the Borrower, so as to ensure that the Debt to Equity Ratio is always maintained.
(c)	The Sponsors shall not Abandon the Project till the Final Settlement Date.
(d)	The Sponsors shall not reduce or modify the equity share capital structure of the Borrower without the prior written approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders.
(e)	The Borrower shall, and the Sponsors shall ensure that the Borrower shall, obtain all necessary Approvals from RBI, Registrar of Companies and/or Governmental Authorities for the infusion of the Base Equity Commitment (or any part thereof).
(f)	The terms and conditions of any loans availed of by the Sponsors for the purpose of infusing the Base Equity Commitment (or any part thereof) shall not adversely affect the interests of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders under any of the Finance Documents.

(iv)	Consents and Approvals

(a)	The Borrower shall have obtained all consents and approvals, statutory or non-statutory, as may be required for the construction, implementation and operation of the Project and execution, delivery and enforcement of the Transaction Documents, including any environmental clearances required to be obtained from the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEF) for the setting up and commencement of the Project.

(iv)	Consents and Approvals

(b)	The Borrower shall procure and deliver to the Security Trustee (acting on behalf of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders) a certified true copy of the no objection certificate/ consent received from the Income Tax Department under Section 281 of the IT Act, along with the acknowledged copy of the original application made to the assessing officer for seeking such consent, prior to the creation of the Security in terms of the Finance Documents, in a form and manner acceptable to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders.

(v)	Appointment of Advisors

(a)	Lenders Legal Counsel 
The Rupee Term Loan Lenders shall have appointed the Lenders’ Legal Counsel to inter alia assist the Rupee Term Loan Lenders in reviewing and finalizing the Finance Documents. The Borrower shall have undertaken to pay or arrange or shall have paid or arranged the payment of all fees, expenses and other charges payable to the Lenders’ Legal Counsel.

(v)	Appointment of Advisors

(b)	Lender’s Independent Engineer 
The Rupee Term Loan Lenders shall have appointed the Lender’s Independent Engineer to undertake the roles including but not limited to review of the Project; review of the Project Documents; (quarterly) review of status of land required for Project and/or Project Site (including non-encumbrances, clearances and Approvals); review of Business Plan, schedule of award; performance tests and operations of the Project, vetting the Project Cost, the contracts for supply of major equipment, including provision for liquidated damages and performance guarantee and other major contracts (including the examination of the reasonability of such contract prices) and/or Approvals. The Borrower shall have undertaken to pay or arrange or shall have paid or arranged the payment of all fees, expenses and other charges payable to the Lenders’ Independent Engineer.

(v)	Appointment of Advisors

(c)	Lenders’ Insurance Adviser
The Rupee Term Loan Lenders shall have appointed the Lender’s Insurance Adviser. The Borrower shall have undertaken to pay or arrange or shall have paid or arranged the payment of all fees, expenses and other charges payable to the Lenders’ Insurance Adviser.

(vi)	Borrower Undertaking

The Borrower shall have submitted an undertaking in the form and manner acceptable to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders stating that:

(i)	The suggestions that may be made by the Lenders’ Legal Counsel, Lenders’ Independent Engineer and the Lenders’ Insurance Advisor on the Project shall be addressed by the Borrower and necessary changes in the Project Documents shall be incorporated

(vi)	Borrower Undertaking

(ii)	The Borrower agrees the Lenders’ Independent Engineer shall monitor the implementation of the Project regularly on behalf of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders and that it shall report the progress directly to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders.

(ii)	Corporate Authorizations, Documents and Proceedings
(b)	The Borrower shall have increased its authorized capital and shall have submitted copies of the amended and updated constitutional documents of the Borrower to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, including but not limited to the copies of their memorandum of association, articles of association, including amendments, to reflect increase in authorized share capital, increase in the borrowing power, appointment of nominee directors, incorporation of any other provisions as may be required by the Rupee Term Loan Lenders in terms of the Finance Documents.

(ii)	Corporate Authorizations, Documents and Proceedings

(c)	The Borrower shall have delivered, a specimen signature of each such Authorised Official of the Borrower along with a resolution of the Borrower approving the appointment of such Authorised Official.

(ii)	Corporate Authorizations, Documents and Proceedings

(d)	The Borrower shall have delivered certified true copies of all corporate authorizations (including any board resolutions) certifying that the Borrower has the necessary powers under Applicable Law to borrow or avail the Rupee Term Loan Facility and enter into the Finance Documents and that the borrowing or availing of the Rupee Term Loan Facility under the Finance Documents would not cause any borrowing limit binding on the Borrower to be exceeded.

(b)	has power and authority to own its property and assets and to transact the business in which it is engaged or proposes to be engaged and to do all things necessary or appropriate in respect of the Project and to consummate the transactions contemplated by this Agreement and the other Transaction Documents.

Capacity

The Borrower has all necessary power and authority to execute, deliver and perform its obligations under each of the Transaction Documents; and each of the Transaction Documents to which the Borrower is a party has been duly and validly executed and delivered by person(s) duly authorised to do so acting on behalf of the Borrower.

Documents Valid And Enforceable

Each of the Transaction Documents constitutes the legal, valid and binding obligations enforceable by and against the Borrower in accordance with its terms. No fees or Taxes, including without limitation, stamp duty, transaction, registration or similar taxes, are required to be paid (other than the stamp duty and registration charges already paid) for the legality, validity, or enforceability of the Transaction Documents. The Transaction Documents are in proper legal form and are in full force and effect for the enforcement thereof without any further action on the part of any person party thereto or successor to such person by way of assignment or otherwise. All acts and conditions required to be performed and fulfilled under the Applicable Law have been performed and fulfilled in order to enable the Borrower to lawfully enter into, exercise its rights and perform its obligations under the Transaction Documents.

Security Documents

(a)	The provisions of the Security Documents, are effective to create in favour of the Security Trustee acing for the benefit of the Secured Parties, in accordance with Applicable Law, a legal, valid and enforceable first priority Security, and all necessary and appropriate recordings and filings have been made in all necessary and appropriate public offices, and all other necessary and appropriate action such as payment of stamp duty on the Security Documents has been taken, so that the Security created by each Security Document constitutes first priority, perfected Security on and in all right, title and interest of the Borrower, as the case may be. The Borrower has neither created nor agreed to create any Security Interest over any of its assets or rights, in favour of any Person other than the Security Trustee acting for the benefit of the Secured Parties.

Security Documents

(b)	The Security created and indemnities and undertakings given pursuant to the Finance Documents to secure the Rupee Term Loan Facility and all other amounts payable in terms of the Finance Documents shall operate as a continuing security until the Final Settlement Date

Registration And Filing

No Default

(b)	No other event or circumstance is outstanding which constitutes a default, or with the giving of notice, lapse of time, determination of materiality or the fulfilment of any other applicable condition or any combination of the foregoing, might constitute a default, under any document which is binding on the Borrower or any asset of the Borrower or the receivables.

No Indebtedness

Information

The information contained in the application/ request made by the Borrower for the Rupee Term Loan Facility and all information submitted by the Borrower in connection therewith (“Credit Application”) is true in all respects as at its date or, as the case may be the date on which it was supplied. The Credit Application submitted by the Borrower has not omitted as at its date any information which, if disclosed, might adversely affect the decision of a person considering whether to enter into any Finance Documents.

(c)	The statements of opinion or belief attributed to the Borrower and the Directors in the Credit Application, were made in good faith and were arrived at bonafide by the Borrower and the Directors, as the case may be, after careful consideration and enquiry and genuinely reflected their respective views.

Material Adverse Effect

There are no facts, circumstances, conditions or occurrences in any case or collectively that could reasonably be expected to result in a Material Adverse Effect.

Project Documents

Project Documents

Insurance

Tax Returns & Payments

AFFIRMATIVE COVENANTS

The Borrower covenants and agrees that until the Final Settlement Date: 

Project Changes

	The Borrower shall promptly notify the Rupee Term Loan Lenders of any proposed change in the nature or scope of the Project and of any event or condition, which might materially and adversely affect the Project or result in Cost Overrun. Any such proposed change in the nature or scope of the Project shall not be implemented and no funds shall be committed therefor without the prior approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders in writing. For the purposes of exercising such consent rights the Borrower shall provide the Rupee Term Loan Lenders a right to diligence the Project and provide access to all necessary information. In case of change in scope of the Project or based on any due diligence carried out by the Rupees Lenders, the Rupee Term Loan Lenders shall be unilaterally entitled to amend the terms of the Rupee Term Loan Facility.

Contract Changes

The Borrower shall obtain prior written approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lender to any modification or cancellation of the Project Documents
(b)	acquire all or part of the assets of any Person, on lease or otherwise, or any class of shares or debentures or partnership interest or similar interest of any Person;
(c)	convey, sell, lease, transfer or otherwise dispose of or mortgage or otherwise charge (or agree to do any of the foregoing at any future time) all or any part of assets:
(d)	convey, sell, lease, transfer or otherwise dispose of or mortgage or otherwise charge (or agree to do any of the foregoing at any future time) all or any part of assets or properties;
(e)	not grant any rights to any third parties in relation to operation or managements of the business of the Borrower; and
(f)	not change its corporate identity legal existence

Financial Covenants

(a)	The Borrower shall ensure that the following are maintained at all times:

(i)	The Total Debt to Tangible Networth Ratio shall not exceed 2.5:1.
(ii)	The Fixed Assets Coverage Ratio shall not be less than 1.50.
(iii)	The Borrower shall maintain a minimum Debt Service Coverage Ratio of 1.20.

(iv)	The Total Debt/ EBITDA shall be lower than the following:

(A)	Lower than 7.00 for Financial Year 2017-18 
(B)	Lower than 6.00 for Financial Year 2018-19
(C)	Lower than 5.00 for Financial Year 2019-20
(D)	Lower than 4.00 for Financial Years 2020-21 and 2021-22
(E)	Lower than 3.00 for Financial Year 2022-23 and thereafter
Threshold:
(A)	Lower than 7.00 for Financial Year 2017-18 
(B)	Lower than 6.00 for Financial Year 2018-19
(C)	Lower than 5.00 for Financial Year 2019-20
(D)	Lower than 4.00 for Financial Years 2020-21 and 2021-22
(E)	Lower than 3.00 for Financial Year 2022-23 and thereafter

Clause from Loan Agreement: (v)	The Borrower shall ensure that the Current Ratio shall not be less than 1.2:1.

Financial Covenants

(b)	The Borrower shall submit to the Rupee Term Loan Lender audited annual financial statements within 120 (one hundred and twenty days) days from the end of each Financial Year, on the basis of which, the maintenance of the Financial Covenants by the Borrower during the tenor of the Loan shall be tested by the Facility Agent. In the event of any adverse deviation of more than 10% (ten percent) in any two or more of the abovementioned Financial Covenants, the Borrower shall be liable to pay Further Interest on the Outstandings. Further, in the event that the Debt Service Coverage Ratio exceeds 1.20, the Borrower shall utilize the surplus cash to prepay the Loan together with all amounts payable under the Finance Documents in accordance with Clause 7 (Prepayments) hereinabove.

Financial Covenants

(b)	The Borrower shall submit to the Rupee Term Loan Lender audited annual financial statements within 120 (one hundred and twenty days) days from the end of each Financial Year, on the basis of which, the maintenance of the Financial Covenants by the Borrower during the tenor of the Loan shall be tested by the Facility Agent. Further, in the event that the Debt Service Coverage Ratio exceeds 1.20, the Borrower shall utilize the surplus cash to prepay the Loan together with all amounts payable under the Finance Documents in accordance with Clause 7 (Prepayments) hereinabove.

Inspection

(a)	The Borrower shall permit representatives of the Rupee Term Loan Lender, including but not limited to the employees and officers of the Rupee Term Loan Lender, the LIE, LLC and any other consultant/advisor/agents as may be appointed by or at the behest of the Rupee Term Loan Lender (at the expense of the Borrower including reasonable travel costs and expenses) to visit, upon suitable prior notice and inspect its offices, properties, the Project Site and the Project assets, to carry out technical, financial and legal inspections; to examine the Borrower’s books of records, account and documents; to make copies there from; and to discuss the Borrower’s affairs, finances and accounts with the Borrower’s principal officers, engineers and auditors (and by this provision the Borrower authorises such auditors to discuss its affairs, finances and accounts). The Borrower shall at all times cause a complete set of the original Project plans and Project specifications and drawings (and all supplements thereto) to be maintained and available for inspection by such representatives. The Borrower shall extend full cooperation and assistance to the Rupee Term Loan Lender in this regard and bear the reasonable expenses incurred by the representatives of the Rupee Term Loan Lender regarding the visit, inspection as above.

Maintenance of Existence; Books and Records

The Borrower shall preserve and maintain its legal existence and shall maintain the Approvals and other rights, franchises, privileges and consents necessary for the maintenance of its existence, the conduct of its affairs and implementation of the Project. The Borrower shall maintain in accordance with Indian GAAP as are necessary to truly and fairly reflect the financial condition and results of operations of the Borrower proper books of record books of accounts, bank statements and other records of the Borrower and in particular, maintain records showing expenditure incurred on the Project, utilisation of the disbursements under the Finance Documents, progress of the Project and copies of all Project Documents and all records relating to the Secured Property

Compliance with Applicable Law and Approvals 
	
(a)	The Borrower shall comply in all respects with all Applicable Law and obtain all Approvals (including pollution board requirements, if applicable) in relation to the conduct of its business and the development, operation and management of the Project.

(b)	The Borrower shall obtain, comply with the terms of and do all that is necessary to maintain in full force and effect the Project Documents, all Approvals (including those as shall hereafter be required under Applicable Law) and any approval required / obtained in connection with: (i) the construction, operation and maintenance of the Project as contemplated by the Project Documents, (ii) the raising of share capital and issue of shares, (iii) the ownership, construction and operation of the Project or any facilities or services ancillary thereto, (iv) the execution, delivery and performance by the Borrower of any Transaction Document to which it is a party, (v) creation of the Security under the Security Documents and for the validity and enforceability and the perfection and ranking thereof (as contemplated therein or herein) and for the exercise by the Secured Parties of their rights and remedies thereunder, and (vi) the admissibility as evidence in India of the Transaction Documents.

(c)	The Borrower undertakes that it will comply with present and future laws, rules, orders, regulations or requirements of any governmental or other authority applicable to it or its property and keep all its properties in its business in good working order and condition, and maintain all its rights, privileges and franchises that are necessary or desirable for the orderly and efficient conduct of its business, and shall conduct its business in an orderly, efficient and regular manner.

Clause from Loan Agreement:
Insurance by the Borrower

(a)	The Borrower shall keep all assets duly insured and at all times adopt a comprehensive insurance programme for ensuring the successful management of risks for the Project and the assets in the manner as required by the LIA and to the satisfaction of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, and for such insurance any indemnity shall be payable in any currency freely usable by the Borrower to replace or repair such goods.

(b)	Prior to the Initial Drawdown Date the Insurance Contracts covering the value of the Project in line with the acceptable industry standards shall have been obtained by the Borrower / its Contractors (which shall include the Borrower and the Secured Parties as the beneficiary, with the understanding that all such Insurance Contracts shall be transferred to the Borrower in a form and manner acceptable to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, as per the terms of the Project Documents), and copies of all shall have been provided to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders including a certificate or other acceptable evidence to this effect and such certificate or other evidence shall accurately describe the insurance obtained by the Contractor/Borrower and shall also certify that all such insurance is in full force and effect and conforms in all respects to the insurance required to be obtained on or before the proposed Initial Drawdown Date. Further, all the above mentioned Insurance Contracts shall have been suitably endorsed in favour of the Secured Parties, in a form and manner satisfactory to the Rupee Term Loan Lender; and the Rupee Term Loan Lenders shall have received a copy of the insurance premium payment receipt and the insurance policy confirming that all premia due and payable as of the relevant Drawdown Date have been paid and no insurance premia are overdue.

(c)	The Borrower shall cause the Contractors performing any services in connection with the Project to keep the insurance described in, and fulfil all obligations set forth in, the Contracts with financially sound and reputable insurers satisfactory to the Facility Agent against loss or damage in such manner and to the same extent as so described.

(d)	The Borrower shall provide the Rupee Term Loan Lenders a list of current insurance policies, detailing therein the names and addresses of the insurer, brief particulars of assets covered, type of cover, amount of cover and date of expiry of each policy. If the Borrower fails to obtain or maintain the full insurance or fails to submit the copies thereof, the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, may (but shall not be obligated to) take out the required policies of insurance and pay the premiums for the same. All amounts so advanced or expended therefor by the Rupee Term Loan Lenders shall be reimbursed by the Borrower and the Borrower shall pay such amounts to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders together with interest thereon at the Default Rate from the date so advanced in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement.

(e)	Within 2 (Two) days after the effective date of any new insurance policy submit to the Facility Agent a certificate, from the Borrower indicating the properties insured, the type of insurance, amounts and risks covered, names of the beneficiaries, expiration dates, names of the insurers and special features of the insurance policies in effect on the date of such certificate, such policies to be in form and substance, and issued by companies, satisfactory to the Facility Agent in consultation with the LIA.

(f)	Not less than 45 (forty five) days prior to the expiration date of any policy of insurance required to be in effect hereunder (or, for insurance with multiple expiration dates, 45 (forty five) days prior to the expiration date of the policy on the principal asset), the Borrower shall deliver to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders a certificate of insurance with respect to the renewal of the relevant policy satisfactory to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders or the relevant insurer as the case may be, bearing a notation evidencing payment of the premium for the relevant renewal policy or accompanied by other proof of the payment satisfactory to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders and confirming the renewal, the renewal period, the amounts insured for each asset or item covered by the relevant renewal policy and any change in terms and conditions from the policy’s issuance date or last renewal. Promptly after receipt thereof by the Borrower, the Borrower shall deliver to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders each such renewal policy. The Borrower shall provide to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders promptly, the documents relating to its insurance.

(h)	The Borrower shall duly pay all premia and other sums payable for the aforesaid purpose. The insurance in respect of the assets charged/ to be charged to the Security Trustee for the benefit of the Secured Parties shall be taken in the joint names of the Borrower and the Security Trustee (acting on behalf of the Secured Parties). The Borrower shall ensure that the interest of the Secured Parties are notified to the insurers and noted on all insurance contracts and policies shall expressly stipulate the Secured Parties as ‘loss payee’ in the policies. All Insurance Proceeds shall be directly credited to the Account designated for this purpose under the Trust and Retention Account Agreement and the same shall be dealt in accordance with the waterfall mechanism provided in the Trust and Retention Account Agreement.

(j)	The Borrower shall promptly notify the Rupee Term Loan Lenders of any loss or other event entitling the Borrower to make a claim under any one or more insurance policies. The Borrower shall promptly notify the Rupee Term Loan Lenders of written notice received by it with respect to the cancellation of, adverse change in, or default under, any insurance policy required to be maintained in accordance with this Clause 14.8 of this Agreement. The Borrower shall not vary, rescind, terminate or cancel any insurance policy without prior permission of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders.

(m)	Concurrently with the financial statements and reports delivered pursuant to the terms of this Agreement, a notice concerning any change to any coverage, premium or other material aspect of any insurance required pursuant to the Transaction Documents occurring subsequent to the last such notice and, in the event of such change, a report from the Borrower’s insurers relating to such change (the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, in such circumstances, being entitled to retain an insurance advisor at the expense of the Borrower to advise the Rupee Term Loan Lenders with respect to such change).

(n)	Within 45 (forty five) days after the close of each Financial Year, a certificate of a duly authorised officer of the Borrower (i) confirming that all insurance policies in respect of the Project required to be then in effect are in full force and effect of the date thereof, (ii) confirming the names of the insurers issuing such policies, (iii) confirming the amounts and expiration date or dates of such policies, and (iv) including evidence of payment of the relevant premiums satisfactory to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders

Taxes on Borrower

The Borrower shall pay and discharge and as of date, has paid and discharged all taxes, duties, cesses and other statutory dues including employee provident fund dues imposed on or payable by it or on its income or profits or on any of its property and all taxes that it has agreed to pay pursuant to any Transaction Document and all lawful claims relating thereto prior to the date on which penalties attach thereto, and shall file all returns relating thereto and has established reserves that are adequate for the payment of those taxes and statutory dues. The Secured Parties shall not be responsible for the compliance of direct and indirect tax obligations by the Borrower.

Clause from Loan Agreement:
Project Operation and Maintenance

(a)	The Borrower shall maintain, preserve and operate the Project and all of its other properties necessary in the proper conduct of its business in good working order and condition, ordinary wear and tear excepted, and in accordance with prudent operating practices and its business plan and replace or rebuild the Project equipment or any of its material property, or any part thereof now or hereafter damaged or destroyed by any event (whether or not insured against or insurable), occurrence of which shall be informed to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders and the Facility Agent.

Project Operation and Maintenance

(b)	The Borrower shall arrange for meeting the requirements of the Project with respect to construction materials, water and construction power, to the satisfaction of the Secured Parties, and shall obtain and comply with the relevant Approvals for arrangements

Project Operation and Maintenance

(d)	The Borrower shall take or cause to be taken all action required to maintain and preserve the Security under the Security Documents and the first ranking priority thereof. The Borrower shall from time to time execute or cause to be executed any and all further instruments and register and record such instruments in all public and other offices, as applicable, in order to create and maintain valid, perfected and enforceable Security of first priority and ranking over the Secured Property pursuant to the Security Documents.

Project Operation and Maintenance

(e)	The Borrower shall take, or cause to be taken, all action necessary to cause the Project Documents and the renewal or replacement agreements to be or become part of the Security under the Security Documents (whether by amendment to the Security Documents or otherwise). The Borrower shall use its reasonable endeavours to cause each person (other than itself) party to each Project Document entered into by the Borrower to execute and deliver to the Secured Parties a consent to such Security in writing, which consent shall be in form acceptable to the Secured Parties.

Project Operation and Maintenance

(f)	Notwithstanding anything contained hereinabove, the Borrower shall ensure that the Borrower’s payment obligations under any unsecured facilities shall at all times rank at least pari passu with all other present and future unsecured indebtedness.

Project Operation and Maintenance

(g)	The Borrower hereby agrees to keep the Rupee Term Loan Lenders informed about any events likely to have a substantial effect on the operations of the Project along with remedial steps proposed to be taken by the Borrower.

Performance of Project Documents

(a)	The Borrower shall perform and observe all the covenants and agreements contained in any of the Project Documents to which it is a party; take all reasonable and necessary action to prevent the termination of any Project Document in accordance with the terms thereof; and enforce each material covenant or material obligation of each such Project Document in accordance with its terms.

Performance of Project Documents

(b)	Following the occurrence and during the continuance of an Event of Default, the Borrower shall request the Sponsors and the other parties to each Project Document to make any payments due and payable by such persons under such Project Documents to the Secured Parties.

Performance of Project Documents

(c)	In the event that the Borrower is entitled under the terms of any Transaction Document to terminate such Transaction Document as a consequence of any default under such Transaction Document by the other Party thereto, the Borrower shall, if so requested by the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, exercise its rights to terminate such Transaction Document within 30 (thirty) Business Days after such request. In the event that the Rupee Term Loan Lenders instructs the Borrower to make a demand or exercise its rights to terminate any other Transaction Document, the Borrower shall: (i) comply with the terms and provisions of each such document with respect to such demand, including providing all supporting documentation in the form and manner required by each such document; and (ii) provide, concurrently with the making of any such demand, notice to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders of any such proposed demand for payment, along with copies of the supporting documentation required to be submitted in connection with such demand under each such document. Provided that in respect of the rights under the Transaction Documents which may be notified by the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, the Borrower shall not exercise such rights except on such terms and conditions as the Rupee Term Loan Lenders may determine. The Borrower also undertakes to keep the Rupee Term Loan Lenders informed in writing prior to an exercise of any right to terminate any Transaction Document.

Performance of Project Documents

(d)	Upon request of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, the Borrower shall replace or consent to the replacement of any Person (other than the Borrower) as a party to any Project Document in accordance with the terms of such Project Document if such Person has failed to perform its obligations under such Project Document.

Performance of Project Documents

(e)	The Borrower agrees and undertakes to deposit with and assign in favour of the Security Trustee acting for the benefit of the Secured Parties any advance payment / performance guarantee provided by the Contractors or sub-contractors in terms of the Contracts.

Property Rights

The Borrower shall take all actions necessary to maintain the Borrower’s good and marketable title / interest to the Secured Property and to the Project Documents free and clear of any charge, lien, encumbrance or third party interest other than the interest created in favour of the Security Trustee acting for the benefit of the Secured Parties under the Security Documents.

Management
	
(a)	The Borrower shall appoint suitable technical, financial and executive staff of proper qualifications and experience for the key posts, and ensure that the Borrower’s set up is adequate enough for smooth implementation and operation of the Project.

Management

(b)	The Rupee Term Loan Lenders shall have the right to collectively appoint, whenever they consider necessary, any person, firm, company or association of persons engaged in technical, management or any other consultancy business to inspect and examine the working of the Borrower and the Project and to report to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders. The Rupee Term Loan Lenders shall have the right to collectively appoint, whenever they consider necessary, any chartered accountants /cost accountants as independent auditors, in consultation with the Borrower only as to selection, for carrying out any specific assignment(s) or to examine the financial or cost accounting system and procedures adopted by the Borrower for its working or for conducting concurrent audit or special audit of the Borrower. The costs, charges and expenses including professional fees and travel and other expenses of such consultants or auditors shall be payable by the Borrower.

Annual Audited Financial Statements

As soon as available and in any event within 180 (One Eighty days (or such shorter period as is required by Applicable Law) after the end of each Financial Year of the Borrower, the Borrower shall furnish to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, the audited statements of income, retained earnings, cash flow of the Borrower for such year, and the related audited balance sheet as at the end of such year, with accompanying notes and setting forth in each case in comparative form the corresponding figures for the preceding Financial Year, and accompanied by (i) an opinion thereon of its Auditor who shall be a reputed firm of accountants and auditors reasonably acceptable to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, which opinion shall state that such financial statements fairly present the financial condition and results of operations of the Borrower at the end of, and for, such Financial Year in accordance with Indian GAAP and (ii) if specifically requested by the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, a certificate of such Auditors stating that, in making the examination necessary for their opinion, they obtained no knowledge, except as specifically stated, of any failure by the Borrower to meet the Financial Covenants. Promptly after the Borrower’s receipt thereof a copy of any “management letter” or other similar communication received by the Borrower from the Auditors indicating that the Borrower’s financial, accounting and other systems are not being, or have not been, properly implemented or supervised or any other information in this regard, a copy of the same shall be delivered to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders.

Unaudited Quarterly Statements

(a)	As soon as available and (i) in any event within 60 (sixty) Business Days after the end of each Fiscal Quarter, the Borrower shall furnish to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders unaudited financial statements of income, retained earnings and cash flow of the Borrower for the quarter then ended and the related balance sheet as at the end of such period, together with accompanying notes, and setting forth in each case in comparative form the corresponding figures for the corresponding period in the preceding Financial Year; and (ii) within 7 (Seven) Business Days of each Fiscal Quarter submit technical reports, operation reports, compliance certificates in a form and manner acceptable to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders.

(b)	Within 7 (Seven) days from the end of each Fiscal Quarter, the Borrower shall furnish to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders: (i) details of any litigation / proceedings to which the Borrower or Directors or Contractors are a party in relation to the Project; (ii) any Force Majeure events or other events having an adverse effect on the Project; (iii) disputes under Project Documents; and (iv) certificate from an independent reputed chartered accountant confirming compliance with the financial covenants set out under this Agreement.

14.20.3	Project Progress Reports 

(a)	The Borrower shall provide regular progress reports on the Project both during construction and operation phases in such form and manner as may be required by the Rupee Term Loan Lenders. Further within 30 (Thirty) Business Days after the end of each Fiscal Quarter, the Borrower shall furnish to the Rupee Term Loan Lender a report on the progress of the implementation of the Project highlighting the deviations of actual, updated schedule of expected physical completion of the Project.

(b)	The Borrower shall cause LIE to submit quarterly progress reports on the physical and financial progress of the Project and also highlight deviations from the agreed Project implementation schedule/plan.

(c)	The Borrower shall provide such evidence and information as may be required by the Rupee Term Loan Lenders to satisfy the Rupee Term Loan Lenders that the physical progress of the Project as well as the expenditure incurred on the Project is as per the original schedule.

Certificate of no Default 

Concurrently with the financial statements delivered pursuant to the terms of this Agreement, the Borrower shall certify that no Potential Event of Default or Event of Default has occurred during such period or, if any, Potential Event of Default or Event of Default shall have occurred, specifying the nature and period of existence thereof, and the remedial action the Borrower has taken, is taking or proposes to take with respect thereto.

Notice of Proceedings

Promptly, and in any event no later than 5 (five) days after the Borrower shall have obtained knowledge thereof, the Borrower shall furnish to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders notice of all claims or proceedings before any Governmental Authority, court, arbitral tribunal or other body against or affecting the Borrower, or for the purpose of revoking, terminating, withdrawing, suspending, modifying or withholding the Project Documents or any Approval necessary for the execution, delivery or performance by the Borrower, or the exercise of its rights, under the Project Documents to which it is a party.

Notice of Default

Promptly, and in any event not later than 3 (three) days after the Borrower obtains knowledge that any default or material adverse effect under any Finance Documents or event of default or material adverse effect as defined under the respective Project Document has occurred and is continuing, provide to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders notice of such event of default, describing the same in reasonable detail and the remedial action the Borrower has taken, is taking or proposes to take to cure such event of default (including the Default). The Borrower shall further inform the Rupee Term Loan Lenders in the event any of the representations and warranties under any of the Finance Documents are untrue or false or in the event such representations become untrue or false or upon occurrence of an Event of Default / Potential Event of Default or Material Adverse Effect

Further Information

The Borrower shall submit to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders every quarter or whenever desired by the Rupee Term Loan Lenders with a progress report on the status of the development plan of the Project during implementation period. The Borrower shall also furnish such other information regarding the business, affairs, prospects, assets or condition (financial or otherwise) of the Borrower as the Rupee Term Loan Lenders may request, including latest income tax returns and income tax / sales tax assessment orders. The Borrower shall deliver to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders copies of all documents dispatched by the Borrower to all its creditors (or any general class of them) at the same time as they are dispatched all communications relating to payment.

Authorised Investments

Concurrently with the financial statements and reports delivered in terms of this Agreement, the Borrower shall deliver to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, a schedule of the Permitted Investments, made from the Accounts as at the end of such quarter, in such detail as the Rupee Term Loan Lenders may require.
