Corporate Governance

14.30.1	The Borrower agrees and confirms that it shall confirm to all mandatory recommendations on corporate governance as per the guidelines issued/to be issued by Government Authority and applicable to the Borrower

The Borrower hereby agrees and undertakes that it shall not induct a person into the Borrower who is a director on the board of director a company or partner / person involved with any bodies corporate whose names have been placed in list of defaulters of RBI and/ or CIBIL and/ or any other agency. In the event such a person is found to be on the board of the Borrower, the Borrower shall take expeditious and effective steps for the removal of the persons from its board or to get their names removed from the willful defaulters list. The Borrower shall broad-base its Directors and employees with competent professional and strengthen its management set up as may be required under the Applicable Law

The Borrower agrees and confirms that it shall cause its Affiliates and partners to confirm to all mandatory recommendations on corporate governance as per the guidelines issued/to be issued by Government Authority. The Borrower hereby agrees and undertakes that it shall ensure that neither the Borrower, nor its Directors or subsidiaries and Affiliates of the Borrower shall appear in list of defaulters of RBI and/ or CIBIL and/ or any other agency.

End Use Certificate 

The Borrower shall, within a period of 30 (thirty) Business days from each Drawdown, submit to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders a certificate from a reputable chartered accountant certifying that the end-use of proceeds of such Drawdown at the time have been utilized only for the purposes permitted under this Agreement

Borrower Credit Rating

(a)	The Borrower shall get itself rated by Credit Rating Agency(ies) within 6 (six) months from Initial Drawdown Date in accordance with Basel III requirements and thereafter at annual intervals and/or such intervals as may be stipulated by the Rupee Term Loan Lenders (“Borrower Credit Rating”), and submit a copy of such Borrower Credit Rating to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders. In the event that the Borrower delays in obtaining the Borrower Credit Rating as required under Clause 3.5(b) (Additional Interest) and this Clause 14.32, then without prejudice to any other remedies that may be available to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders under Applicable Law, the Borrower shall also be required to pay Default Interest to the Borrower on the Advances computed from the Initial Drawdown Date till the date of compliance with the provisions of this Clause 14.32.

(b)	The Borrower shall ensure that SDFIPL is rated at the minimum investment grade rating to the satisfaction of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders and the details of the same shall be delivered to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders.

Undertakings From the Sponsors

The Borrower shall, procure and furnish the Sponsor Support Undertaking from the Sponsors in favour of Security Trustee (acting for the benefit of the Secured Parties), in a form and substance satisfactory to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders inter alia agreeing to meet any shortfalls in the completion of the Project. The Borrower shall ensure that all Cost Overrun are financed by the Sponsors and specific obligation to this effect should be captured in the Sponsor Support Undertaking

Financial Statements of the Sponsors

As soon as available, but in any event within 180 (one hundred and eighty) days after the close of each Financial Year (or such shorter period as is required by Applicable Law), the Borrower shall provide the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, copies of the annual audited financial statements of income, retained earnings and cash flow of the Sponsors for such year and the related audited balance sheet as at the end of such year, setting forth in each case in comparative form the corresponding figures for the preceding Financial Year, and accompanied by an opinion thereon of its Auditor who shall be a reputed firm of accountants and auditors reasonably acceptable to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, which opinion shall state that such financial statements fairly present the financial condition and results of operations of the Sponsors at the end of, and for, such Financial Year in accordance with Indian GAAP

Maintenance of Ownership Interest

(a)	The Borrower hereby undertakes that it shall not permit/ register a transfer of any interest in the Borrower without the prior consent of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders.

(b)	The Borrower hereby agrees and undertakes that it shall ensure that SDFIPL continues to retain Management Control of the Borrower and continues to hold at least 50% of the issued and paid up share capital of the Borrower on a fully diluted basis.

Other Information

From time to time provide such information, documents or reports (financial or otherwise) as the Rupee Term Loan Lenders or Secured Parties may require, including any information pertaining to the physical progress and expenditure incurred for the Project.

(a)	The Borrower shall create a DSRA, for an amount equivalent to the Debt Service Reserve by setting up a separate Account in the form of fixed deposits and available Project cash flows with the Facility Agent and duly mark a lien on such Account in favour of the Secured Parties. An acknowledgement of such lien, once created, shall be provided by the Borrower to the Facility Agent, a prescribed format for which has been set forth in Schedule 6 (Letter of Lien and Set-Off) hereto

(b)	1 (One) quarter DSR shall be created upfront in the form of fixed deposits with the Account Bank and the DSR for the balance 1 (One) quarter to be created from the cash flows of the Project available after meeting debt service obligations of the Borrower within a period of 6 (Six) months from SCOD. The Borrower will have the option to substitute cash DSR amount available with equivalent value of letter of credit or bank guarantee without recourse to the Project assets and in a form and manner acceptable to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders

(c)	The amounts accumulated in the DSRA shall not be used for any purpose other than for servicing of the Loan. The amount in the DSRA would be utilized only in case of a shortfall in Project cash flows for meeting debt service requirements from time to time.

(d)	No payments of dividend to equity shareholders, interest or repayments to the providers of Subordinated Debt, if any, shall be made until the required appropriations/ replenishments shall be made to the DSRA, to the satisfaction of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders and except with the prior written consent of Rupee Term Loan Lenders. The Company shall invest the funds in the DSRA only in Permitted Investments.

Other Borrower Undertakings 

The Borrower hereby agrees and confirms that:

(a)	The Borrower shall maintain adequate books of accounts which should reflect true and fair view, its financial position and scale of operations and should not change its accounting system without prior approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders

(b)	The Borrower shall not enter into any agreement / arrangement with its Sponsors or its directors and with its Affiliates without the prior written approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders and any such arrangement / agreement shall only be entered into on an arms’ length basis.

(c)	The Borrower will, every half yearly, submit to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, Annexure III of the RBI circular “Lending under consortium arrangement/multiple banking arrangement” certified by professional with regard to compliance of various statutory provisions.

Compliance in relation to “Know Your Customer Policy”

Each of the Borrower and the Sponsors shall have provided satisfactory evidence to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders of having complied with “Know Your Customer Policy” norms as specified by the Rupee Term Loan Lenders.

Arrangements for Working Capital requirements

The Borrower shall make arrangements for prior to COD and maintain till the Final Settlement Date, adequate working capital for the Project to the satisfaction of the Secured Parties

Project Covenants

(i)	The Borrower shall maintain the Debt to Equity Ratio of 58.6:41.4, and such Debt to Equity Ratio shall not exceed 1.5:1 at any time till the Final Settlement Date.

(ii)	The Borrower shall ensure that SDFIPL maintains an investment/total debt ratio of at least 2x, at all times.

NEGATIVE COVENANTS


The Borrower shall: 

(a)	not, unless otherwise permitted in terms of the Transaction Documents, effect or agree to effect any change in its capital structure including equity and debt patterns envisaged hereunder or take and shall not agree to take any action of merger, consolidation, reorganisation or amalgamation takeover or undertake any other schemes of compromise or arrangement without the prior written approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders
(b)	not use the trademark, trade names, service marks, logos, designs, copyright or other similar proprietary rights of the Secured Parties without the consent of such Secured Party.
(c)	not acquire all or part of the assets of any Person, on lease or otherwise, or any class of shares or debentures or partnership interest or similar interest of any Person

(d)	not convey, sell, lease, transfer or otherwise dispose of or mortgage or otherwise charge (or agree to do any of the foregoing at any future time) all or any part of assets except in the ordinary course of business

(e)	as regards the assets, not convey, sell, lease, transfer or otherwise dispose of or mortgage or otherwise charge (or agree to do any of the foregoing at any future time) all or any part of assets or properties without the approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders in writing.
(f)	not grant any rights to any third parties in relation to operation or managements of the business of the Borrower

(g)	not without the prior written approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders (i) buy back, cancel, retire, reduce, redeem, re-purchase, purchase or otherwise acquire any of its share capital now or hereafter outstanding, or set aside any funds for the foregoing purposes, and/or (ii) issue/allot any further share capital whether on a preferential basis or otherwise or change its capital structure in any manner whatsoever
(h)	not change its corporate identity

Scope of Project

The Borrower shall not alter the scope of the Project include undertake any new project, or augment, modernize or expand the scope of the Project, or any amend any Project Documents without the prior approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders in writing

Third Party Interest over Security

Unless otherwise consented to in writing by the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, the Borrower shall not create any Security Interest over the assets of the Project including Project cash flows and the Receivables other than those created in terms of the Security Documents

Nature of Business, Subsidiaries, Change of Location of Offices, Investments

The Borrower shall not engage in any business other than the Project in India, create any subsidiaries, change its name, or change the location of its offices, or make any investments whether by way of deposits, loans, or investments in share capital or otherwise, in any concern or provide any credit or give any guarantee, indemnity or similar assurance except with the prior approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders in writing or as otherwise permitted under the Finance Documents

Amendment etc. of Project Documents 

The Borrower shall not make any modification to the Project Documents or terminate any of the Project Documents, except with the prior written approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders

Debt

		The Borrower shall not, directly or indirectly, create, incur, contract, assume or suffer or otherwise become or be liable for any Debt, with any other person or bank or financial institution or otherwise, and shall not issue any debentures or raise any loans except the Permitted Indebtedness. Further, the Borrower shall not undertake any additional debt in the form of fund-based or non-fund-based facilities from any lender other than the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, without the prior written approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders

Abandonment

The Borrower shall not Abandon or agree to Abandon the Project

Improper Use

The Borrower shall not use, maintain or operate, or allow the use, maintenance or operation of the Project for any purpose which may constitute a public or private nuisance or give rise to a claim or environmental claim; violate any provision of any Applicable Law or the Transaction Documents; and result in a material increase in the premium of any insurance then in force with respect to the Project or any part thereof

Subordinated Debt

Monies brought in by way of loans (including mezzanine debt) or share application money pending allotment towards the funding of the Project (“Subordinated Debt”), by the Directors or Sponsors of the Borrower/ any other person including the group companies (“said Persons”) shall be subordinated to the Rupee Term Loan Facility, and the same along with interest shall not be due and payable before the Final Settlement Date. The Borrower shall not repay any such Subordinated Debt brought in by the Sponsors without the prior written consent of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders. Further, all such Subordinated Debt shall be unsecured and subordinated, but may be interest-bearing.

Other Transactions

Except for the Transaction Documents, the Borrower will not enter into any partnership, profit-sharing or other similar arrangement whereby the Borrower’s income or profits are, or might be, shared with any other person, or enter into any management contract or similar arrangement whereby its business or operations are managed by any other person except with prior written approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders

Restriction against disposal of Interest

The Borrower shall ensure that the Sponsors do not dispose or change their interest in the Borrower without the prior written consent of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders. Further, the Borrower shall not, without the prior written consent of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders recognize or register any transfer of shares in the Borrower’s share capital made or to be made by the Sponsors and/or their Affiliates

Constitutional Documents

The Borrower shall not amend, modify or supplement its constitutional documents in any manner without the prior approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders in writing

Existing Management 

The Borrower shall not make any major change in the management set up, without the prior approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders in writing.

No Appointment of Wilful Defaulter on the Board of the Borrower

(a)	The Borrower shall not appoint a person as its director / employee/ adviser who is also a director on the board of any other company or involved in the business of any corporate entity, which has been identified as a wilful defaulter by any bank or financial institution as per the parameters determined by Reserve Bank of India from time to time. 

(b)	If any such person is already a director / employee/ adviser of the Borrower, the Borrower shall remove or cause to remove such person.

Change of Financial Year

The Borrower shall not change its Financial Year without the written approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders

Utilisation of Project Proceeds

The Borrower shall not enter into any agreement with any lender or any person relating to utilisation of the Project Proceeds without the prior approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders in writing. Further, the Borrower shall not make any unbudgeted expenditure.

Utilisation of Project Proceeds
The Borrower shall not make any unbudgeted expenditure.

Contractual Obligation

The Borrower shall not incur any contractual obligation including guarantee obligation, without the prior approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders in writing.

Guarantee Obligations 

The Borrower shall not, without prior approval in writing of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders undertake any guarantee obligations on behalf of any other person including group companies.

Winding Up

The Borrower shall not wind up, liquidate or dissolve itself or its business and affairs or initiate or cause to be initiated, any proceedings or actions in relation to the foregoing.

Assignment

Other than the assignment/ hypothecation as security of the Project Documents and any other Transaction Documents created (X) in favour of the Security Trustee acting for the benefit of the Secured Parties in terms of the Finance Documents and/or (Y) for securing any of the Permitted Indebtedness, the Borrower shall not: (i) enter into or permit the assignment of any rights or obligations of the Borrower to any Transaction Document; or (ii) consent to or permit the assignment of (except to the extent that such assignment constitutes a Permitted Security Interest) any rights or obligations of any Person (other than the Borrower) under any Transaction Document.

Advances and Loans

The Borrower shall not, lend money or credit or make deposits with or advances (other than deposits or advances in relation to the payment for goods and equipment as required and permitted by the Transaction Documents) to any Person (including the Affiliates of the Borrower), or make any capital contribution to any other Person (including the Affiliates of the Borrower).

Disputes

The Borrower shall not agree, authorise or otherwise consent to any proposed settlement, resolution or compromise of any litigation, arbitration or other dispute with any Person (including any dispute under the Project Documents) without the prior written approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders.

Accounting Method

The Borrower shall not change the accounting method or policies currently followed by the Borrower

Commission
The Borrower shall not pay any commission to its directors, managers, or other persons having substantial interest in the Borrower for furnishing guarantees, counter guarantees or indemnities or for undertaking any other liability in connection with any financial assistance obtained for or by the Borrower or in connection with any other obligation undertaken for or by the Borrower for the purpose of the Project.

Events of Default

16.1.1	An Event of Default occurs upon the occurrence of any of the following specified events (each an “Event of Default:

(a)	Payment

(i)	Failure by the Borrower in the payment when due of any principal, interest or default interest or fee or any other amount owing under any Finance Documents on the due date for payment thereof.

(ii)	The Borrower is unable or has admitted in writing its inability to pay any indebtedness as they mature or when due.

(iii)	Failure by any of the Obligors in making the payment of any amounts when due under any Finance Document.

(b)	Non Performance

(i)	Failure by the Borrower and/or any of the Obligors, to perform any of their respective obligations (other than payment obligations as specified in Clause 16.1.1(a) above) under the Finance Documents, and where such default is capable of remedy and has not been remedied within a period of 30 (Thirty) days from the date of such failure.

(ii)	Any event of default occurs under any Transaction Document (other than the Finance Documents), on the part of any party to such Transaction Document, including by any counterparty to such Transaction Documents, and where such default is capable of remedy, has not been remedied within a period of 30 (Thirty) days.

(c)	Cross Default

(i)	The Borrower fails to pay any of its creditors any principal of or premium or interest or any other amounts on any of its debt when due, which is not cured within a period of 30 (Thirty) days thereof. 

(ii)	The other Obligors fail to pay any of their creditors any principal of or premium or interest on any of its debt, when the same becomes due, which is not cured within a period of 30 (Thirty) days thereof.

(d)	Representations and Warranties 

Any representation or warranty confirmed or made or deemed to be made, by the Borrower, the other Obligors and/or any of the counter parties to the Transaction Documents including in connection with the execution and delivery of, or under, any Transaction Document (including in connection with any Drawdown) is incorrect and/or misleading in any material manner, when made or deemed as made.

(e)	Failure to Perform, Breach and Non Compliance

(i)	The Borrower or the Contractors or the Directors or any other counter party to the Project Documents or Transaction Documents shall fail to obtain, renew, maintain or comply in all respects with any Clearance including approvals from Government Authorities for the execution, delivery, performance and enforcement of the Transaction Documents, or any such Clearance shall be rescinded, terminated, suspended, modified or withheld or shall be determined to be invalid or shall cease to be in full force and effect, or any proceedings shall be commenced by or before any Governmental Authority for the purpose of rescinding, terminating, suspending, modifying or withholding any such Clearance, which is not cured within a period of 30 (Thirty) days from the date thereof.

(ii)	It is or becomes unlawful for the Borrower and/or the other Obligors to perform any of their respective obligations under the Transaction Documents or such obligations cease to be valid and binding obligations of such Persons or a Transaction Document is required by Applicable Law to be modified, waived or repudiated, 

(iii)	It is or becomes unlawful for the counter parties to the Project Documents to perform any of their respective obligations under the Transaction Documents or such obligations cease to be valid and binding obligations of such Persons or such Transaction Document is required by Applicable Law to be modified, waived or repudiated, and the Borrower has not promptly replaced such counter party with a Person acceptable to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders. 

(iv)	The Borrower sells, assigns, disposes, charges or otherwise encumbers or places a Security Interest on any of its assets other than as permitted under the Finance Documents without the prior written approval of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders. 

(v)	One or more events, conditions or circumstances, shall exist or shall have occurred which have had and continue to have, or, in the judgment of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, could be reasonable expected to have a Material Adverse Effect.
Tag 5: Covenant Description/ Sub tags: Breach Financing Documents, Breach Other Documents

Clause from Loan Agreement:
(f)	Project

(i)	The Borrower ceases to have the right to possess, control or use all or any portion of the Project site or any other assets which is not remedied within a period of 30 (Thirty) days thereof.

(ii)	The implementation of the Project, in the opinion of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders is not in accordance with the Transaction Documents. 

(iii)	There occurs a prolonged Force Majeure affecting the Project which is in force for a period of 3 (Three) months starting from the occurrence of such Force Majeure event. 

(iv)	Disposal of the Project Site and/or any of the assets of the Borrower which is not remedied within a period of 30 (Thirty) days from the date thereof

(g)	Abandonment or Suspension of the Project

(i)	The Borrower has Abandoned the Project for any reason whatsoever. 

(ii)	The operation of the Project has been suspended for a prolonged period exceeding 30 (thirty) days starting from such suspension, for any reasons. 

(iii)	The Borrower takes or refrains from taking a decision which act or inaction can be reasonably said to be establishing the lack or loss of the interest on the part of the Borrower in the Project.

(h)	Cessation of business

The Borrower ceases or threatens to cease to carry on its business or gives notice of its intention to do so or if the Borrower abandons all or any part of the assets required or essential for its business or operations or if such assets are damaged or destroyed or in the opinion of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, there occurs any change from the date of the this Agreement in the general nature or scope of the business, operations, management or ownership of the Borrower, which is not cured within a period of 30 days

(a)	Viability of the Project

One or more of the events, conditions or circumstances shall have occurred or exists having Material Adverse Effect on the viability of the Project

(j)	Insurance

(i)	The Borrower fails to maintain any of the Insurance Contracts or any such insurances remain lapsed for any reason whatsoever without the provision of a replacement therefor.

(ii)	Any Insurance Contract contracted or taken by the Borrower is not, or ceases to be, in full force and effect at any time when it is required to be in effect or any insurance is avoided, or any insurer or re-insurer avoids or suspends or becomes entitled to avoid or suspend, any insurance or any claim under it or otherwise reduce its liability under any insurance or any insurer of any insurance is not bound, or ceases to be bound, to meet its obligations in full or in part under any insurance

(k)	Court Order, Government Actions

(i)	Any Governmental Authority shall have condemned, nationalised, seized, or otherwise expropriated all or any part of the property or other assets of the Borrower or the other Obligors or of the Equity or any interest in the Equity, or shall have assumed custody or control of the shares of the Borrower held by a Sponsors or of the shares of the Sponsors, or shall have assumed custody or control of such shares or property or other assets or of the business or operations of the Borrower or the other Obligors or shall have taken any action for the dissolution of the Borrower or the other Obligors or any action that would prevent the Borrower or the other Obligors or their respective officers from carrying on its business or operations or a substantial part thereof
(ii)	An attachment or restraint has been levied on all or any material part of the assets of the Borrower or the Contractor(s) or the other Obligors.

(iii)	Failure by the Borrower or the other Obligors to pay one or more amounts due under any judgments or decrees which shall have been entered against the Borrower and/or the other Obligors, as the case may be, and the same remains unpaid within the time period specified in the relevant judgment or decree.

(iv)	Any Legal Proceeding under or relating to any Applicable Law shall have been instituted against the Borrower and/or the other Obligors with respect to the Project. 

(v)	Any Government Authority takes or threaten (to the best knowledge of the Borrower) to take any suo moto action with a view to regulate administer, or limit or assert any form of administrative control over the rates applied, prices charged or rates of return achievable, by the Borrower in connection with its business, which has a Material Adverse Effect. 

(vi)	Execution or distress being enforced or levied against the whole or any part of the assets of the Borrower or any of the counterparties to the Project Documents, where any such order has not been discharged or stayed within a period of 90 (ninety) days from the date of such enforcement or levy

(l)	Security

(i)	Any Security and/or additional comfort required to be created is not so created within the time period specified in this Agreement and/or the Finance Documents once executed and delivered shall fail to provide the Security Interests, rights, title, remedies, powers or privileges intended to be created thereby (including the priority intended to be created thereby) and/or such Security Interest shall fail to have the priority contemplated in such Finance Document and/or any such Finance Document shall cease to be in full force and effect, and/or the validity thereof or the applicability thereof to the Drawdowns and/or the Security Interest purported to be created thereby is jeopardised or endangered in any manner whatsoever or any other obligations purported to be secured or guaranteed thereby or any part thereof shall be disaffirmed by or on behalf of the Borrower or any other Party thereto.

(ii)	The occurrence of any event or circumstance which, in the sole opinion of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, is prejudicial to or imperils or depreciates the Security given to the Rupee Term Loan Lenders 

(iii)	Seizure of material assets of the Borrower by the creditors of the Borrower and/or by any other person

(m)	Winding Up, Bankruptcy and Dissolution

(i)	If the Borrower, the other Obligors or any of the counterparties to the Project Documents including the Contractors commence a voluntary proceeding under any applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, winding up or other similar law now or hereafter in effect, or consent to the entry of an order for relief in an involuntary proceeding under any such law, or consent to the appointment or taking possession by a receiver, liquidator, assignee (or similar official) for any or a substantial part of its property. 

(ii)	If an involuntary proceeding against the Borrower, the other Obligors, or any of the counterparties to the Project Documents including the Contractors has been commenced under any applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, winding up or other similar law now or hereafter in effect, or in any case, proceeding or other action for the appointment of a receiver, liquidator, assignee (or similar official) for any part of its property, or for the winding up or liquidation of its affairs, or other action has been admitted by a court or other Governmental Authority, which is not stayed or withdrawn within a period of 30 (Thirty) days from the date thereof.

(iii)	The Borrower, the other Obligors, or any of the counterparties to the Project Documents including the Contractors have taken or suffered to be taken any action towards its restructuring, liquidation or dissolution.

(iv)	Any of the Borrower or the Contractor(s) or the other Obligors or any of the counterparties to the Project Documents has made a reference or has been declared as a sick industry or is, in the apprehension of the Rupee Term Loan Lender, likely to be declared as a sick industry under the Sick Industrial Companies (Special Provisions) Act, 1985. 

(v)	If a liquidator, assignee (or similar official) or receiver is appointed for any part of the property of the Borrower, the other Obligors, the Sponsors or any of the counterparties to the Project Documents including the Contractors, or for the winding up or liquidation of the affairs of the Borrower, the other Obligors, or any of the counterparties to the Project Documents including the Contractors.

(n)	Project Documents and Finance Documents 

(i)	This Agreement or any of the other Transaction Documents or any provision hereof or thereof: 

(A)	is or becomes invalid, illegal or unenforceable or any party thereto shall have repudiated or disavowed or taken any action to challenge the validity or enforceability of such document, or which could reasonably be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect; or

(B)	except as otherwise expressly permitted hereunder, ceases to be in full force and effect except at the stated termination date hereof or thereof, or shall be assigned or otherwise transferred or prematurely terminated by any party thereto prior to the Final Settlement Date.

(ii)	A default or failure to fulfill obligations has occurred under any of the Transaction Documents and in the case of:

(A)	a default or failure by the Borrower under a Project Document which failure or default, if capable of remedy, is not remedied within the applicable grace period under such Project Document;

(B)	a default or failure by any of the counter party to the Transaction Documents (other than the Rupee Term Loan Lender), which default or failure (i) has continued un-remedied beyond the applicable grace period, if any, under the Transaction Document; and (ii) constitutes, in the judgment of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, a Material Adverse Effect.

(iii)	A default or failure by any party to the consents to assignment/ hypothecation (other than the Secured Parties) or a notice of termination is issued under the consent to assignment/ hypothecation.
Tag 5: Covenant Description/ Sub tags: Breach Project Documents, Breach Financing Documents

Clause from Loan Agreement:
(o)	Change in Management Control 

(i)	Failure by the Sponsorsto continue to hold Management Control. 

(ii)	Change in ownership and control of the Borrower in breach of the provisions of the Finance Documents

(p)	Illegality

(i)	It is or becomes unlawful for the Borrower or any Person (including the Secured Parties) to perform any of their respective obligations under this Agreement or any Finance Document either on account of change in applicable law or otherwise; or

(ii)	Any obligation under any Finance Document is not or ceases to be a valid and binding obligation of any Person party to it or becomes void, illegal, unenforceable or is repudiated by such Person (other than the Secured Parties).

(q)	Material Adverse Effect

(i)	A Material Adverse Effect occurs or exists

(ii)	One or more events, conditions or circumstances shall exist or shall have occurred which have had and continue to have, or in the judgment of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders, could be expected to have a Material Adverse Effect

(r)	Financial Covenants 

(i)	The Financial Covenants specified in Clause 14.4 of this Agreement have not been maintained. 

(ii)	The Borrower has failed to maintain the minimum DSRA in terms of the Finance Documents

(s)	Extra-Ordinary Circumstances 

If extra-ordinary circumstances have occurred which in the sole opinion of the Rupee Term Loan Lenders gives reasonable ground to believe that it is not possible or probable for implementing the Project and for the Borrower to fulfil its obligations under any of the Transaction Documents, including the payment obligations

(t)	Borrower Credit Rating 

Failure on the part of the Borrower to obtain and maintain the Minimum Credit Rating in the manner as set out in this Agreement within a period of 6 (six) months from the date of Initial Drawdown Dateand/or failure on the part of the Borrower to get the Borrower Credit Rating done annually or at such intervals in terms of the Finance Documents

Taxes And Net Payments

All payments to be made by the Borrower to the Secured Parties under the Finance Documents shall be made free and clear of and without deduction for or on account of Taxes unless the Borrower is required to make such a payment subject to the deduction or withholding of taxes, in which case the sum payable by the Borrower in respect of which such deduction or withholding is required to be made shall be increased to the extent necessary to ensure that, after the making of the required deduction, the Secured Parties receive and retain (free from any liability in respect of any such deduction) a net sum equal to the sum which it would have received and so retained had no such deduction or withholding been made or required to be made, except if the deduction or withholding was made in respect of any Taxes calculated with reference to the net income received by the Secured Parties, provided that the Borrower delivers to the Secured Parties tax withholding or tax deduction certificates in respect of such withholding or deduction. If the Borrower is required by law to deduct any payment, the Borrower shall promptly provide certificates with respect to such deductions to the Secured Parties as per prevalent law and pay to the Secured Parties such further sum to ensure that the Secured Parties received the same amount as if no deduction had been made

Receipt

The Borrower shall deliver to the Secured Parties within 30 (thirty) Business Days of receipt (or such other period as the Secured Parties may agree) a copy of the receipt, if any, issued by the applicable taxation or other authority evidencing the deduction or withholding of all amounts required to be deducted or withheld from such payment or (if the Borrower fails to provide a copy of such receipt) such other evidence as may be requested by the Secured Parties
